# Ryan O’Loughlin
### Philosopher of Science
#### climate models • uncertainty • decision-making

I study how climate scientists generate **trustworthy knowledge** with imperfect models, and how that knowledge should inform **real-world decisions**.

## What I Work On {#what-i-do}

:::{.grid .gap-4}
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-lg-6}
### Big Questions
1. How do models represent **uncertainty** in climate science?  
2. What makes results **robust** and **trustworthy**?  
3. How should policymakers interpret model **uncertainty**?  

[Explore Philosophy →](research.qmd#why-trust-science)
:::
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-lg-6}
### Bridge to Science
1. Clarifying **model evaluation** and ensemble reasoning  
2. Making uncertainty **actionable** for decision support  

[For scientists →](research.qmd#bridging-science-and-philosophy)
:::
:::
